'''Expeditions''' is a system where Players can dispatch their [[characters]] to gather [[materials]] or [[Mora]].

The Expedition system is unlocked at [[Adventure Rank]] (AR) 14 by completing the World Quest "[[Busy Adventurers' Guild]]." They can be accessed by speaking to [[Katheryne]] and selecting the [[File:Icon Dialogue Expedition.svg|22px]] dialogue option with [[Katheryne]] at any branch of the [[Adventurers' Guild]]. Expedition locations are unlocked when the [[Statue of The Seven]] that covers the location's [[area]] is unlocked.

==Overview==
Any character besides the [[Traveler]] can be dispatched on an expedition for 4, 8, 12, or 20 hours to return with rewards (note: characters that are K.O'd cannot be sent on expeditions until they are revived). The character is dispatched in name only; they will still be usable on the field. The type of rewards are determined by where the character is sent, but the amount of each resource received may vary slightly. The timer for the duration of each individual expedition counts down even when the player is not online.

A player can recall a character from an expedition at the Adventurers' Guild, but this will forfeit any rewards that would have been granted.

When Expeditions are first unlocked, players can only send two characters on expeditions at once. By raising their Adventure Rank, they can increase the Expedition Limit cap, which increases the number of characters that can be sent out at once.

Note: Upon entering [[Ritou]], the expeditions to Jinren Island, Konda Village, and Byakko Plain are unlocked. Nazuchi Beach, Tatarasuna, and Musoujin Gorge require completing [[Chisato's Letter]].

==Character Bonuses==
Certain characters' [[Exploration Talents]] reduce their own expedition durations in a specific nation by 25% or give bonuses for completing expeditions.
